question.body: Which would be the correct order from smallest to largest?

multiple_choice.choice: HCl (an acid), Bile salt, secretory cell, small intestine

response.feedback: Incorrect. Enzymes are proteins which are macromolecules and are bigger than an ion.

Correct. HCL is a small acid, then bile salts are larger macromolecule that have a steroid structure, secretory cells are larger than just macromolecules and the small intestine is an organ that is larger than a single cell.
Incorrect. This order would be from largest to smallest. The stomach is part of the GI tract so is smaller than it.
Incorrect. Epithelial cells are larger than bile which is a macromolecule.
